Entries.default: [Leave.]
[Tap into the soul energy at the construct's core.]
[Order the construct to kill Tangara.]

Rising to its full height, the construct possesses a more intentional bearing than before. Heat builds from somewhere in its gut, radiating off the armor.

You have no doubt that it will carry out its order with brutal efficiency.
[Speak the words of the command scroll.]
"Back away! That rusted wreck is a work in progress."
The construct looks at you with flat, murderous intensity.
Now that it is operating normally, the construct favors you with a subtle nod.
The construct trembles and rattles, its vacant gaze wandering without purpose. Habit and routine are seemingly the only forces keeping it upright.
The construct abruptly hardens its bearing and turns to you, standing at attention.
You read the words of the scroll, doubtful of the faded, arcane scribblings until a tingling sensation passes your lips.
It seems that conflicting instructions from too many masters has led to the rapid degeneration of this construct's short-term memory.
[Wipe the construct's memory.]
[Go back.]
You reconsider your approach. The construct regards you impassively.
You draw out the babbling, incoherent mess of instructions received over the years. The construct trembles throughout the procedure.
The construct now stands at ease, regarding its surroundings with fresher clarity.
"This should be interesting."
"Oops."
[Leave.]
The construct stares back at you in silence.
"Maybe you'll prove useful later."
